svg.text:
Too Small Sample Size: ┌────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ • Low statistical power │ │ • Can't detect real effects │ │ • High false negative rate │ │ • Wasted engineering effort │ └────────────────────────────────────────┘
Too Large Sample Size: ┌────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ • Wasted time and resources │ │ • Delayed decisions │ │ • Opportunity cost │ │ • Detects trivial effects │ └────────────────────────────────────────┘
Just Right Sample Size: ┌────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ • Adequate power (typically 80%) │ │ • Reasonable experiment duration │ │ • Detects practically meaningful effects│ │ • Efficient use of resources │ └────────────────────────────────────────┘
